comments.author: Sithara007
comments.body: Anyone want to discuss about the tragic death of Adam Johnson? He was representing Nottingham Panthers in Elite Ice Hockey League (the first tier hockey league in United Kingdom). On 28th October, during a match against Sheffield Steelers, he suffered a freak accident in which he suffered a slash to his neck by skate. Matt Petgrave of Sheffield Steelers was responsible for the accident and from the video, it looks like Petgrave deliberately kicked Johnson's neck with the blade of his skate. Johnson was just 29 years old. Neck guard has been made mandatory in all EIHL matches after this incident. Video: https://twitter.com/EndWokeness/status/1718859769962693064/video/1

comments.author: Hirose UK
comments.body: There are two types of hockey sports but both are not very popular in almost all countries, both are ice hockey and field hockey but the easiest one to find is field hockey because the way to play is easier and doesn't require so many special coaches if it just for fun playing around.As for the World Hockey Championship itself I don't know whether it is still being participated in by many countries or not because many people are no longer interested in hockey even for athletes hockey is no longer of interest to teenagers.Ice hockey was first introduced and was quite popular in Europe but as time progressed this sport began to lag behind and most people preferred to football which became the sport with the greatest popularity.Currently only Canada has made hockey their country national sport and there we can find quite a lot of special schools for every hockey athlete.Apart from Canada I don't know about it because this sport is not well known in the country I live in, maybe we can have deeper discussion here about the sport of hockey.
